cons: They just docked everyone's benefits

pros: Premium pay in lieu of benefits a great option
cons: My supervisor has the same degree as me and sees herself as upper management. Supervisors are supposed to be good leaders, but she is unavailable and unapproachable. Every new employee under her is told, "Asking questions is not allowed and you have to find the answers yourself". Isn't that scary for a healthcare system?

pros: I work with many people behind the scenes who are often overlooked. We work to very hard with little recognition but Revenue Cycle is one of the best teams to be on. We are cohesive and function as a fine-tuned machine. The health insurance is great, compensation is at market levels, and we all take pride in our job. My Director takes vested interest in all of her employees and I greatly value her guidance. I have been at MHG for 10 years and have seen a lot of changes but we never faulter in our dedication to do the right thing.
cons: I am located off site and do not have many of the benifets  hospital based employees enjoy like the cafeteria, vendor sales and the like. Communication could be better to those of us off site.

job_title: Lead Respiratory Therapist in Gulfport, MS
pros: great benefits and some good coworkers the facility is beautiful after the current remodel, thee grounds are great and the food can be awesome with so many choices of cuisine.
cons: It's a who you know not what you know situation. It doesn't matter how long you have excelled in your field or how much education you have its who is your friend and your in your click to get ahead.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Gulfport, MS
pros: The facility was set up nicely, and the protocols were followed ensuring a safe enviroment for patients and staff.  The staff members were very dedicated to each other and presented a united front.
cons: Many of the cases were difficult and required constant care (including constant visual contact).  Trying to schedule staff for the patient load was never easy and during times when it was short staffed, documentation would fall short.

review_title: Large Facility, with too many bosses
pros: Large hospital, Plenty of "busy work" when things are slow to help the day pass. Lots of employee coverage on every shift, so nobody is severely overworked.
cons: Pay is only relevant to education, job experience pays no factor into this. Too many bosses and people you are expected to know and make a good impression on.

review_title: This is a great job as long as you get a good office to work at.

cons: Not enough holiday hours earned to cover all the time the Dr takes off and the office is closed.

pros: I have throughly enjoyed working for Memorial. They care about their employees and offer comparable pay. On our floor we all work together really well.
cons: On some floors the staff to patient ratio is high. You have to be out of work for two full days before you are allowed to take your sick time hours.
